document.masterDocTitle: Genus Stathmopoda Herrich-Schäffer, 1853 (Lepidoptera: Stathmopodidae) from China (III): Descriptions of fourteen new species

Diagnosis. This species is similar to
S. fusciumeraris Terada, 2013
externally and internally, but it can be distinguished by the forewing having a broad brown streak along costal 3/4 bifurcate from its distal 3/10, the valva almost uniformly wide to rounded apex and the aedeagus lacking a cornutus; the antrum with an inverted conical plate posteriorly and the appendix bursae with 50 denticles. In
S. fusciumeraris ,
the forewing has a brown streak along costal margin not bifurcate distally, the valva is narrowed to the apex and the aedeagus has a cornutus; the antrum lacks an inverted conical plate posteriorly and the appendix bursae has 9‒14 denticles basally.
Stathmopoda aprica
is also similar to
S. sufusciumeraris
sp. nov.
externally and internally, and the differences between them are stated in the diagnosis of the new species.

Description. Adult ( Fig. 7 ). Wingspan 12.0‒ 14.5 mm . Head with frons shining yellowish white; vertex and occiput ochreous yellow, with metallic luster. Labial palpus yellowish white on inner surface, second segment pale ochreous yellow on outer surface, third segment ochreous yellow on outer surface. Antenna with scape ochreous brown, greyish white on anterior margin; flagellum ochreous yellow. Collar, thorax and tegula ochreous yellow; thorax with a dark brown spot posteriorly. Forewing yellow; costal margin with a broad brown streak along basal 3/4, its distal 3/10 bifurcate; with three blackish brown spots: basal spot narrowed from fold to dorsal margin, connected with costal streak anteriorly; second spot between basal 1/3 and 2/5 of dorsal margin, anteriorly reaching above fold and fused with costal streak; third spot between basal 3/5 and 4/5 of dorsal margin, reaching beyond outer margin of cell and connected with posterior arm of costal streak, then weakening toward apex; fringe brown, mixed with ochreous brown, ochreous brown around apex. Hindwing grey; fringe pale ochreous brown. Legs ochreous yellow on dorsal surface, cream white on ventral surface; foreleg with tibia and tarsus brown on outer surface; midleg blackish brown at base and middle on dorsal surface, tibia with cream white bristles at middle and apex; hindleg with tibia with long ochreous yellow bristles at apex dorsally, tarsus with long ochreous yellow bristles at apices of basal tarsomere on dorsal surface, blackish brown at apex. Abdomen greyish brown on dorsal surface, white on ventral surface.
Distribution. China ( Hainan , Yunnan ); Japan ( Terada 2016: 70 ), Sri Lanka .
Notes. This species is newly recorded for China .
